comment: Please take someone else's class, the course load for her lecture isn't manageable (especially if you're taking other difficult classes), and she isn't great at getting back to emails.

She cares about ensuring your success as a student. She gives plenty of time to complete assignments, most of which are group assignments. She is not a tough grader, in my opinion. I really enjoyed her class and recommend her.
rating_tags: Group projects--Caring

comment: She was a caring professor, she cares about you becoming a successful student. Overall the class is easy with mostly group projects.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Caring

comment: *This is for SCM* She's the mother in the room. VERY easy A. SCM I think is one of those new reqs for bio/biochem/chem students. Most of the assignments are free, however can drag you if you don't keep up with the class. It's easy to the point where you forget it's still a class with assignments.
rating_tags: Group projects--Caring

comment: Dr. Singh was a great professor for biochem. She had clear grading criteria and had other assignments to help your grade so it wasn't so test heavy. Exams were hard and detailed but that's how biochem is. She was very helpful in office hours and always willing to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Singh is very funny and she is very helpful during lab. She gives us guidance on pretty much exactly what to do which is super beneficial. We had to write a research paper, do a presentation video, and we had our normal labs. Overall doable but the amount of assignments was a bit excessive. Take her though, she's super chill.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback

comment: This class made me cry. I would spend 6+ hours/day (in just the first few weeks, after which I dropped the course) slaving over the material and not understanding a bit of it. My mom, who has worked in the medical field for 25+ years, tried to help me and she couldn't understand the homework, even after reading the textbook/taking notes. Skip!!!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Singh was probably one of the most crankiest professor's I've had by far. She would get very annoyed when no one would speak up and answer questions during lecture or when you asked questions. She was also very disorganized and took forever to grade labs and tests. I would avoid but since its taught in two parts its pretty much impossible
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr Singh is nice and lays out the course in a manageable manner. Most of the work is finished during class time and this course can be used with 4500k to replace the research credit for biochem majors (check with your counselor first).
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is so sweet and really cares about helping you get the best grade possible! Although there is a lot of homework, it's pretty easy and it'll help boost your grade. Sometimes the tests will have questions that were on the previous quiz.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I took her chem class online and I've taken a few online classes, but her class was a struggle. You have to complete 2 lengthy mastering chemistry assignments which are terrible, written assignments, and 2 test every week. Her course online is definitely work heavy and she uses lockdown browser + webcam excessively. Take her as a last resort.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is by far the worst professor I've taken at KSU. First off she is very rude and talks to her students like complete trash. Whenever you ask a question she answers you with a question and tries to make you feel like a complete moron. Grades very hard. I took half of the class online due to corona and she was terrible with the transition. AVOID
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: She takes a long time to grade so you don't know how you're doing in the class until the end. She forgot to give us a periodic table on the exam until I asked. She would be very rude if you didn't understand something, but she would still be willing to help. Responds quickly to emails. VERY easy grader on submissions, participation, and notebook.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Singh was a fantastic professor! She genuinely cares about how you do. She made herself incredibly available outside of class and was always there to answer any questions. CHEM 1211 is not a hard class to pass, what matters is the amount of time and effort you put into the course; just like any other subject. I highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: It was overall not a bad class. She was pretty good at teaching the material but she seemed to get irritated with us easily which could be difficult. There were study sessions before every test which was very helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Stay away. Doesn't teach all material required for tests and often doesn't teach but instead tells students to teach themselves instead. Only 4 tests but one is dropped. Various homework assignments which are completion. Lots of online homework via Mastering Chemistry.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Does not play well with others. Inappropriately condescending. Shes down right nasty to her students.

Chem is a really hard subject and she cares and wants you to succeed. However, her teaching style wasn't my favorite. She is very sarcastic and sassy, but I enjoyed that about her. My tip is to glance thru the CH in the textbook before you come to class- that makes it a lot easier to get it
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: AVOID

She is just not a good professor. I have never had an issue with a professor before, until her. Honestly, she must have tenure or something because she should not be teaching, she very condescending and sometimes just plain nasty to her students.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Pretty much agree with what everyone is saying. Avoid.

She is overly emotional and disorganized. She does not manage her time well and constantly goes over on lecture times, then yells at the class for packing up, as if we dont have other classes to get to. She takes out her frustration with her own incompetence on her students. Avoid her if you can.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really not a good choice. She is rude and disorganized. She loses assignments and will skip class to do recreational stuff. Unprofessional and the worst professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: while I will say that Professor Singh can come off as being rather moody I think she did really care about her students. She posted a lot of extra learning materials online for people to use to help supplement the lecture. She also answered the couple of emailed questions I had very promptly.

Terrible terrible professor. Very disorganized, always loses papers, and you can tell she isn't good at time management because she literally flies through powerpoints without explaining much of what is on there. Chemistry is hard by nature, and she makes it worse by her poor classroom management. DO NOT TAKE!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took this class about a year ago. She is a nice lady and attempted to help you learn. However, her teaching style was hard for most of the class including myself to adapt to. It seemed as though she never provided enough examples to understand the material. She gives a lot of homework which helped me learn some topics but for the rest I was alone
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is rude and disorganized. Avoid taking her if you can, beware she loses your work all the time!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Singh is a sweet woman and means well but I did not learn much. She hardly ever had powerpoints and almost every class we had a worksheet to do. She would work out one problem on the worksheet and then we would do the rest. I never knew if I was doing it right or if I got the right answer. She makes you feel dumb when you ask a question.

She is rude and disorganized. She expects everyone to have their act together all of the time, but she is disorganized and always forgetting things. She is snarky towards students who ask her simple questions, and she is overall not a good teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Pretty much what everyone is saying. She's very nice and sweet, but for the love of God she cannot teach or carry a single organized lecture. If you want an A, take someone else. I don't think we had a single A, and our class was 70+ students. Do yourself a favor and take someone else!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great teacher!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: PLEASE AVOID TAKING HER! If you have to it'll be okay, you just have to work a lot harder. I like chem, but her class was very hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is good professor but as a student u have to read the textbook. The material is hard, but she always has office hours. USE THEM!! The tests are sometimes hard but ALL of them can be replaced with the ACS. We used Tophat textbook, which was way better than mastering chem and the textbook material was easier to comprehend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Had her for biochem. For the love of God, avoid! As a person she is nice, but as an instructor/the person who controls your grade, she is TERRIBLE! Biochem with her will be a lot of anxiety and tears because you will have no clue what will be on the exams. Ask her what to study and she will say "everything". Again, nice lady, but AWFUL teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Singh is a sweet lady but however, her class was NOT so sweet. She did not give us any extra assignments to help us with our grades. The tests were very difficult and I did very poorly on most of them. I busted my behind trying to pull off an A on my homework. Too bad homework only counted as 20 percent of our grade. NIGHTMARE!!!!!!
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: had her 3 times a week and she skipped through most of the powerpoints to make sure she finishes the powerpoint. She does not show her work on the board which makes it hard to follow. No study guides, so random info from the many slides will appear. Best way to study is just do ALL the worked out problems on her slides. Didnt learn anything in clas
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: Professor Singh is a pretty good professor if you know you're going to show up to class and actually listen to her lectures. Her accent may be a bit hard to understand at times, but she's pretty concise when it comes to the various topics in class. It's college chemistry so of course it won't be an easy class, so make sure you put in the effort.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Would take again

comment: Honestly, this is just crazy! Where they get these professors is beyond me. She taught the class at a fast pace pulling numbers out of no where. 50% of her test were on topics she never even discussed. She did not answer questions clearly and would assume everyone got it. We had a sub for 2 weeks and they were by far 100% better. Avoid if possible
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Singh is by far the worst professor I have ever taken. She is knowledgable on the topic and a okay lecturer, but no correlation between whats on the test and taught in class. She doesn't make any study guides or provide any help. The review sessions she holds before test cover roughly 5% of what will be on the test.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: The only good thing about this class is that she drops your lowest exam. Other than that, get ready because it will be a bumpy ride! EXTREMELY disorganized, and when she left the country for 2 weeks, we had no sub and she tried to give online lectures. Fail! The least she could do is bump us a bit. Sucks she's the only one that teaches Biochem 1.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Tests are tough

comment: Very sweet lady, but cannot keep herself organized when it comes to teaching and telling what will be on the exam. The best word to describe the class is "chaotic". The book really helps, so use that. One thing I really didn't like is that she got mad whenever we asked what to study for the test. If you have other options, don't take her!!!
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--Tests are tough

comment: An absolutely terrible professor for biochem! She gets mad when we ask her what we should study (she said "This is an upper level! You should know everything!!!"). Extremely disorganized, and her tests are nightmares. Oh, and she left the country for 2 weeks in the middle of the semester, and we had no sub! AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Singh isn't clear on what needs to be known for tests. Studied what she took the most time on in class, maybe two questions about it on the test. She doesn't understand that not everyone is a master chemist. If this is a prereq, choose another professor
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Singh moves very quickly, faster than the average student can follow. Her tests are nothing like the lecture, and she assigns a ton of homework. The class has no real structure, and concepts get thrown around with no context and whole sections are covered in minutes. Do not take unless you have already mastered chem. Hard class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very sweet lady & a joy to talk to in her office, but she doesn't play around when it comes to exams. She is also very disorganized, & there will usually be typos in her email responses. For that I would not take her again. If you've taken chem in high school and are okay with bad email responses, you'll be fine. If its your 1st chem clas, avoid.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious--TEST HEAVY

comment: Let me start out by saying she is very funny and I enjoyed her personally. However, she moves too fast. If you're like me and have never taken a chemistry class, you are going to fall behind fast. She does a problem pulling numbers from I have no idea where they come from. If you have a busy work load choose another professor or don't take Chem.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Chemistry is an extremely hard subject, but Professor Singh definitely made it bearable. She appears very tough on the outside, but definitely cares about all of her students. When you go to her office hours, she will help you one on one with any problem or area you need. She expects you to work hard, but so long as you do that, you will do fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's a pretty good professor. tries to make it easier for you to understand the criteria. Even though she may rush through some things it's definitely clear what's going on. It really just takes memorization skills to recall a lot of equations etc. She also makes it clear that her office hours are AVAILABLE! And her accent is easy to understand.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I took Professor Singh over the summer, and overall it was not that bad. Chemistry is hard in general, but she made it bearable. She definitely has a hard personality & expects you to understand at the pace she goes at. All of the slides get posted on D2L though and they help a lot. She boosts  your final grade at the end of the semester for sure!

This class was challenging by nature, and Prof. Singh did a fine job teaching the material. It is not impossible to get an A, just know you have to work for it. I did feel like I had to self-teach myself quite often though.

*Newsflash* CHEM1211/chemistry in general is hard. Everyone giving a poor review on here is probably no longer a science major.   Dr. Singh makes her lectures really interesting, she's really laid back and understanding, and she really cares for each of her students. She's also funny and easy to talk to. I highly recommend her.

Not too bad, but definitely not the greatest. She moves too fast, and does not care if students understand the material or not. She just keeps going. Expect to teach yourself. Oh, also Tons of Mastering Chem homework. Averaging forty questions per chapter.

She is extremely condescending when she lectures, if you don't get it don't ask questions. My class has been behind nearly every time I entered the Lab portion of my chem class. Although we are moving what I think is fast, we aren't keeping up with the pace of the semester. 5 class meetings are left before the final and we still have 4 chapters 2go

I do not suggest this teacher if you want to actually be taught the material. She goes so fast which partially is not her fault (has tons of material and only so many weeks). However what gets me is she'd get so mad when you'd ask for help. She rushed through problems and doesnt allow you to learn it before moving to the next problem.

Ms. Singh has been probably the best Chem professor I could have asked for. I have always struggled with chemistry, but Ms. Singh is clear and makes sure everyone understands the concepts. I wish there were more grades for this class, but she does everything she can for her students. Doing well in this course depends on outside studying.

Took her for Medicinal Chemistry, the class content was really interesting. We learned about drug development and design, what the drug target would be, etc. Covered ADME and pharmaceutical dosages. You need to be specific on tests but they all come from her quizzes and powerpoints. The class is really useful if you're looking into pharmacy school.
I like Dr. Singh! She's funny and absolutely no-nonsense. This was chem lit so it's an easy 2 credit class. Don't be an idiot, and be respectful. There you go. Easy A.

Professor very straight forward. Textbook not needed as she gives powerpoints and lectures to cover everything but the textbook definitely helps for extra understanding. Willing to help if you go to her and talk too. Overall, one of the better professors here! Definitely recommend over others.

Biochemistry is pretty hard for chemistry majors since chem majors don't need to take biology courses. But Dr. Singh is willing to help if you come to her office hours. You must come to the class , pay attention to her lectures, and take good notes. Tests are hard but if you read her notes, powerpoint, and textbook, you will pass her class.

She is a good teacher, boring but good. She actually moves at a slower pace than most Chem professors so if you dont catch on easily she is your best bet! Her test are straightforward and she is willing to help you if you go to her. After being a BIO major I can say she is one of the best when it comes to clarity and making sure you understand.

Yet another class with Dr. Singh. Get ready to work, and learn. I worked my butt off, but got an A. Other people will complain, she is a great teacher and always willing to help. She does drop one test. The final is effing brutal.

Good Professor. Moves at a pretty rapid pace so its good to go to class even though it isnt mandatory because you will fall behind. Very clear in her lessons and she makes sure that you understand before she moves on. studying is a most though.
Really good professor who is eager to help students. She will however treat you like an adult which is expected of people over 18 who are able to drive a car.  Really cares about her students.
avoid at all cost

Took her for Bio 1 in the summer, which was ALOT of work in half the amount of time. Great professor, simple test taken straight from HW, 2 hour comprehensive final, just show even a little effort and she will help all she can, it's not difficult to get an A, even for non-majors if your willing to study and actually try  !

Had her for recitation and at first the class seemed useless, but after a few weeks it became very helpfull. I had gabrielli(sp) for lecture and I wish I would have recitation more. She has a different and sometimes better way of teaching.

Despite all the comments, take into account that chemistry can be rigorous. Dr. Singh is very smart but can be short tempered at times. Recitations help a lot, so be sure to attend. A bit of self-study outside of class wouldn't hurt, but she is an overall good teacher. I ended with an A+, but did quite some work for it. It's not impossible to pass.
Avoid by anymeans!!!! worest instracter ever, extreemly unfair grading, practice feveratizem

I thought she did a fine job.  The lab manual sucks but that was not her fault.  She seemed to know what she was doing and her personality seemed fine.  She was nice to everyone and I did not notice previous comments of getting mad.  However this was a lab.

Singh carries a rigorous class so attendance and constant study is demamded but it's not impossible to get on A or pass. The test can be tricky but attending recitations and asking her questions (most times welcomed) will help. She tends to have some attitude but just on her good side, and quizzes are take-home. The final was relatively easy.
Difficult Class. Tests are all essay questions, no multiple choice. Some test questions are unclear. Partial credit is given. Grading is fair. Uploads slides to webCT. Willing to help.
Great professor! Lectures are clear, homework is very effective, and she gives hints about what will be on exams. Extremely knowledgeable and approachable.

Very good professor. Chem is a hard class but she was always avalible to help you. She really wanted her students to do well in the class. I went to her office a few times during the semester and she went over the material until I understood.

Singh was a horrible professor! I tried so hard to pay attention and make good grades but no matter what I did it was never enough. She doesn't care about class and looks really angry when you ask her to clarify something like she expects you to know everything. She also grades unfairly. Do not take her!
she is always grumpy when she is teaching in class, but otherwise ok

Seems ok when you start, then as the sem. goes on you can see the class lose understanding of her.  Most of her lectures she posts on the web.  So if you miss class your ok.  The class avg. after the last test was failing.  many people failed the class. Not very helpful in the lab either.  Would not recommend.

She is a very tough teacher. I had to work problems constantly throughout the semester. I learned alot by staying ahead. If you want to make good in Chem 2, she's the teacher for you. I was a step ahead in Chem 2. You get a bang for your buck!
Very hard teacher. Her tests are extremely difficult compared to what has been taught. The final is way easier cause she doesnt make them. Get some other teacher.
Not a very good teacher...she teaches in an odd way and doesn't finish her examples. She also quizzes and tests very hard. Try to get someone else before you take her =/

Good professor. Willing to help and explain any material not understood. If you actually study before the test (meaning every other night, not the day before an exam) you will do well. Some test questions are tricky, but it isn't anything she hasn't mentioned or gone over. Read the book, study the notes, and you will survive.

She sucks as a teacher.  I asked her to do an example other than from the book she couldn't do it!  She incompetient in lab as well she knows little to none about chem BTW she is a bio major not a chem major...not her calling
her tests were not reasonable. being in classes was not helpful for me at all. i had to come back home and study from the text book all over again.

Reading the book doesnt help. Test questions are very random. Dont take this teacher if you have the choice to take another. I studied and went to class reguarly and failed all the tests and I have 3.9 GPA. Very intense course!!! Expects you to know everything about the chapters for the tests.
If you do your regular studying, she isn't bad.  Chemistry is hard, but this teacher makes it seem easy.  Everything begins to become really easy after she teaches it. A+++++++

She knows the material, however lacks teaching and articulation skills. Self conscious about everything, thats why she yells if you speak in class.  Reading the book doesnt help, test questions are random. Easily confused, which may work to your advantage.  Delayed for lab, so dont expect much.  Great thing about her, she's always willing to help!
Really not that bad. It doesn't seem as though she really wants to be there-- like she'd rather be doing something else besides teaching Chem I...  Maybe she missed her calling...
Do NOT take her.. Take my advice!!
VERY intense! Pretty hard..... Think elsewhere..

One of the most difficult classes I've ever taken. The tests were very hard and most people didn't do very well on them. However, she made herself very available if people needed help - I have her home and cell phone numbers written somewhere because she gave them to us in case we had questions.

Difficult and time consuming course. Be prepared to do a lot of studying and reading.  A bit disorganized and frustrating at times, but this was her first time teaching this course at SPSU.  Very willing to assist you with any problems though.
Completely random.....stresses you out beyond belief.....tends to repeat alot of stuff so she doesn't cover as much material
